content.statement: bvt-001-blunt-aortic-injury is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Trauma Blunt-Vascular that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

grade_II.management: Consider TEVAR vs observation with serial imaging

presentation.physical_exam: Often unremarkable; may have upper extremity hypertension, pulse differential (rare)

imaging.chest_xray: Widened mediastinum (unreliable), left apical cap, deviation of NGT to right
imaging.ct_angiography: Diagnostic standard - defines injury grade and anatomy

immediate.bp_control: SBP <100 mmHg, HR <100 - reduce wall stress

definitive.tevar: First-line for most BTAI; lower mortality than open
definitive.open_repair: If TEVAR not anatomically feasible or unavailable
definitive.timing: Delayed repair (24-72hr) if hemodynamically stable; immediate if unstable or contained rupture expanding

definition.@value: Traumatic injury to thoracic aorta from deceleration forces, typically at the isthmus, requiring urgent TEVAR or open repair

clinical_pearls: Isthmus = most common site (just distal to left subclavian)
80-90% die at scene - survivors have contained rupture
TEVAR is now first-line with 50% mortality reduction vs open
Delayed repair (24-72hr) often preferred in stable patients with other injuries

sources.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
